clinical_study.brief_title: A Study on Nutrition Support Therapy of Patients With Liver Failure
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinic Trail on Nutrition Support Therapy of Patients With Liver Failure

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a Clinical trial to assess the efficacy of nutrition support therapy of patients with liver failure. Patients were randomized to one of 2 groups to receive different nutrition and energy support treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients with liver failure (defined by APASL) induced by any precipitating factors were randomized to two groups; a treatment group and a control group. Participants in treatment group were provided with a standard hospital diet that provided 25-30 kcal/kg/day . Patients in control group receive diet guide

primary_outcome.description: The percentage of death of liver failure patients at 4 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: survival rate on 4 weeks and 3 month

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory variables on serum biochemistry markers
secondary_outcome.description: Laboratory variables on serum lever of glutamic-pyruvic transaminase/glutamic oxalacetic transaminase/total bilirubin/ cholinesterase will be combined to report liver function

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory variables on fasting blood sugar
secondary_outcome.description: Laboratory variables on serum lever of fasting blood sugar

arm_group.description: All study participants were provided with a standard hospital diet that provided B25-30 kcal/kg/day
All study participants were not intervened with diet

intervention.description: patients were provided standard hospital diet that provided 25-30 kcal/kg/day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male and female patients from 18 to 65 years of age;
2. Patient inclusion criteria: jaundice (serum total bilirubin ≥5 mg/dl) and coagulopathy (INR ≥ 1.5 or prothrombin activity ≥ 40 %), accompanied by ascites and/or encephalopathy within 4 weeks.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Surgery with in 4 weeks
2. three degree hepatoencephalopathy
3. malignant tumors
4. cardiac failure or respiratory failure
5. liver transplantation within observing period -
